ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Early Italian canon and understanding of its movements and authors; how to read medieval texts; italian speaking/writing practice
I developed useful literary skills that allowed me to analyze literature from this time period and analyze it from the perspective of the literary movements and historical contexts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great course overall! Most of the authors are super interesting -- a few authors were hard to thoroughly evaluate since this is a survey course, but you get a great overview of the most important italian authors of this time period and an unbiased perspective on the cultural value of their writings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: For sure! I was initially intimidated by the prospect of engaging in these texts after having only really read textbook excerpts in italian, but Simona knows how to guide you through engaging with these texts in a productive and engaging way.
